title: I've been trying to make a single loop video but it keeps breaking up
self_text: Does anyone have any tips for making single loop videos? I want to try and do an animation where it plays on repeat, so any help would be appreciated!

title: I can't seem to find a study that has shown that dogs and cats have no impact on human health, so why do you not allow me to bring them to your classes?
self_text: As someone who is trying to raise a family and support her children, it would be nice if the university could accomodate my request. I am going to school in order to be able to support my family as well as create a better future for my kids. I want to continue doing that without having to worry about being banned from attending class or losing out on credits due to my pets. If there are any concerns regarding safety, I can provide proof of vaccinations and temperament tests! I would also be happy to take all necessary precautions such as wearing an apron when handling my pets during class or keeping them on a leash. I hope you consider my situation and grant my request. Thank you for your time.

title: Anyone else have problems with their dog not eating wet food?
self_text: My dog has been refusing to eat wet food for about a month now, and I've tried everything.  I've warmed it up, mixed it with broth or chicken, added some of his dry food on top, etc. Nothing seems to do the trick! What are you guys doing to make your dogs eat wet food?

title: What are the best ways to study for the MCAT?
self_text: Hey everyone! I’m a freshman at UC Davis who is planning on going to medical school in the future, and I want to be as prepared as possible for the MCAT.   I know that I need to have good grades, but that isn’t enough. The MCAT is just as important, so I need to make sure I am ready for it.   I was hoping some of you could give me advice about how to study for the MCAT, what resources you would recommend, and any tips or tricks that you may have learned along the way.  Thanks in advance!

title: What’s up with the lack of information on the new season?
self_text: I can't find any info on the upcoming episodes/air dates anywhere online! I have been checking every site possible, and all that is available is a generic press release from last year saying it would be released in the spring. The only thing that seems to change are the dates for when they will be released in certain countries but not here in America.

title: I want to start a new collection and am looking for suggestions!
self_text:
I have been collecting for years but have never had an actual goal in mind besides just collecting things I like, which is usually just random shit from my childhood or whatever looks cool on the shelf. Now that I'm trying to get rid of some of my stuff, I figured it would be time to create a real goal.
I was wondering if anyone could help me brainstorm what type of collection to start now? Some ideas I have are:
- comic books
- figurines
- vinyl records
- toys (like star wars figures)
- stickers
- video games
- baseball cards
- art prints
- anything else you can think of!
I’d really like something that will actually take a lot of effort to collect so it won't just end up being another half-finished thing on my shelf. Let me know what you think!

title: MCDB 104AL and MCDB 104BL - How do you choose?
self_text:
Hey everyone, I’m a second year biology major with an interest in biochemistry. I am thinking of taking MCDB 104AL (Intro to Molecular Biology) and MCDB 104BL (Intro to Cell Biology) next semester. My goal is to take a few upper-level biochem courses, so I was wondering if the two courses are too redundant, or if there are any differences between them that would make it worth taking both.

title: I don't understand what a 'scent' is for a dog and why it makes them act strange
self_text: Okay, so my friend has a new dog who is acting really weird. When you smell him he starts barking and running around like crazy. He also barks when you smell other dogs. My friend said that they have been told the dog has a "scent" but doesn't know what it means. I looked up "scent" on Google and found out that it is related to pheromones and how dogs can detect these. Is it possible that his dog smells things that we cannot? How do they use their noses to find those scents? Are there different types of scents?

title: How can I keep my dog entertained when he is alone?

He is a medium sized golden retriever with lots of energy so it’s hard to find things to do to keep him busy! What are some good ideas to occupy your dog when you’re away from home?

self_text: It’s so hard to say goodbye to my boy, but at least I know he knows I am here for him every day. He's a good boy who does not deserve to be alone.

title: How do you actually get the "bumping" sounds in The Last of Us Part I?
self_text:
I've been playing The Last of Us Part I again, and I noticed a very distinctive "bumping" sound that only occurs when I run around the world map or explore in some of the towns. It seems like it happens much more often than I recall from my first playthrough (and even from videos I've watched).  I know the game is supposed to be a little rough around the edges due to the source engine and fidelity differences, but I can't figure out what it is. It almost sounds like someone is just randomly bumping into things with their hands or something.

title: How to get rid of a cat's odor permanently?
self_text: I have a very well-behaved, very clean, and very happy cat named Cleo who is also the source of an overwhelming amount of permanent cat odor that I can not seem to eliminate despite my best efforts.   I use enzymatic cleaners, air purifiers, and even pay for professional deep cleaning on a monthly basis with a company that specializes in pet odors. They tell me they are doing everything they can but it still lingers.  I am considering getting her some kind of anti-bacterial shampoo or something like that but I don't want to do anything that will harm her. What else could I be doing? Any suggestions? Thank you!

title: I think I'm sick of the whole 'I hate the holidays' thing
self_text: Can we please stop? Like, okay, some people have had bad experiences with family, or are just generally depressed. That’s fine, let them be sad. But then you get a bunch of people saying “I HATE THE HOLIDAYS” like it’s an aesthetic. It’s not an aesthetic, it’s not cool, and frankly, it’s irritating to listen to when all I want is a nice quiet evening with my cat, but everyone wants to do a huge party or go shopping for hours. If you don’t feel like doing any of those things, that’s also fine, but please don’t tell me you hate it. Thank you.  And no, I am not trying to make anyone feel bad about their feelings. Just...please let me enjoy my evenings in peace.

title: Is it just me or is the new episode of The Last Of Us going to be a shitshow?
self_text: I’m so incredibly disappointed with the direction they are taking the story and how they're handling the characters after the first half of the series was incredible. Like, they went from being so good at building atmosphere and suspense to just throwing everything at the wall and hoping something sticks. Ellie is being written like she has zero agency and is just reacting to events instead of driving them. I don’t know what’s worse, that the writing has gotten so much worse or that the showrunners have completely forgotten about the heart of the original game.

title: Need to ship a very fragile item to Seattle, WA

title: I've been thinking a lot about the show and I think we could have done so much better, especially if they'd listened to me.
self_text: I really think that the way they handled the situation with Rob was bad and didn't make sense at all. They made him out to be the villain, when he was actually just trying to do what was best for the family. It would have been a better show if they'd allowed us to see his point of view more often. And it also feels like they didn't allow Rob to come up with solutions, and always had him going against everything everyone else wanted to do. I feel like the way they were portraying Rob in the show was very unfair to him, and I don't think anyone should have to deal with the amount of hate that he got from watching the show. I feel like there are people who enjoy the show but aren't watching it closely enough to notice the problems that they put Rob through and how badly he was treated.  I would love for them to bring back some episodes where we can see what Rob was thinking. It would be nice to hear him talk about his thoughts on things as well.

title: Is there a way to automatically check if the carpool is full before I get in?

title: Need help with a very specific question about my dog!
self_text: My name is [Your Name] and I’m really worried about my dog, which is a miniature poodle named Cooper. He’s a year old and has been having these random seizures for the last couple of weeks. They’re usually pretty short - about 10-20 seconds long - but they’ve been getting longer lately (now up to 30-45 seconds) and more frequent (starting every few days now).  I’ve taken him to the vet twice so far and he ran some tests, but everything came back normal. The first time, they did an MRI and blood work, but nothing showed up.  The second time, they did a seizure alert test and it came back negative.  They said that the seizures are probably from anxiety or stress, and gave me some medication for that. But the seizures have continued since then.  I'm starting to get really worried because they seem to be getting worse and more frequent, and I don’t know what else to do.  I'd really appreciate any advice you guys could offer. Thanks in advance!

title: How to fix the error "Cannot use an indexer on a value of type 'int'"
self_text:
I have the following code in my python script.
```python
def print_variable(x):
    print(x)
```
I am getting the following error when I try to run it.
```
TypeError: Cannot use an indexer on a value of type 'int'
```
What can I do to fix this?
I tried using the following code, but I still get the same error.
```python
def print_variable(x):
    print(x[0])
```
Can you help me please?
```
